Hey Rob in NYC,

Check out ActiveTestSuite in the documentation.  It's a test suite where
each test is run in a separate thread.  I've done that before, but don't
expect too much in the way of performance metrics.  You'll definitely find
out if you have any problems like choking and dying, though.

Later,
-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: tukhus [mailto:tukhus@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 02, 2002 10:46 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel threads?


Am new to Java/EJB and would like to do a number of throughput tests 
in parallel in seperate threads, to simulate simultaneous users 
pounding away at my beans' methods.

Can anyone recommend a package out there that will extend JUNIT to 
provide this functionality?  

Can't help but think that this is a common problem, already solved!

TIA!

Cheers,
Rob in NYC
